intro: Sida subspicata, commonly known as the slender sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy, alternate leaves. Its small, pale yellow flowers are clustered in racemes, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Sida subspicata is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in warm, humid climates.
